Welcome to my homepage!
I am an agricultural economist. My current research agenda has been broadly focused on using behavioral economic theories and experimental economic and applied econometric methods to analyze interconnections among food systems, food policy, and human decision-making related to agriculture sustainability issues. My research covers both consumption and production sides of agricultural systems. My work has been published on peer-reviewed journals such as Agribusiness: An International Journal, Applied Economics, Ecological Economics, HortTechnology, and Water Resources Research.
I have also been fortunate to work in interdisciplinary research teams to conduct outreach works. Specifically, I develop economic decision support tools and analyze the economic feasibility of using sustainable agricultural production technologies and practices in farm operations.
